result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwan D Bogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.24(1).
  • Possession of a Firearm by A Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
COURT ORDERS THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Maintain work and/or school.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
No possession of illegal drugs.  No possession of prescription medicatin without a prescription.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety with random testing.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the data bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges while on probation to convert to a civil judgment.  Cash bail to apply.
As to all costs, surcharges if the defendant is incarcerated, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of Extended Supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
-Court orders restitution set at $0.

Defendant Antwan D Bogan in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court ordered a $500.0 fine plus costs.
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 72 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE), with credit days to be determined; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 36 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.  

The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program". 

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS.  

Court orders the following conditions of probation and extended supervision: 
 
- Serve 360 DAYS in the House of Correction with huber release.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatments
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- mental health assessment and any recommended treatment
- no possession of illegal drugs, no possession of prescription medication without a prescription
- maintain work and/or school 
- 25 hours of community service

Court orders restitution set at $0.
  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges while on probation to convert to a civil judgment.  Cash bail to apply
As to all costs, surcharges (if the the defendant is incarcerated), Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;

Attorney Virginia m Stuller in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for Antonella Aleman for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SES.
  Defense counsel has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance. State requests bench warrant be issued.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be ISSUED and STAYED pending next court date.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Antwan D Bogan in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller as standby counsel.  Defendant Antwan D Bogan in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SES.
Matter is scheduled for Doctor's Report Return. Doctor's findings state Defendant is competent to proceed, but not competent to represent himself. For reason as set forth, Court finds Defendant is competent to proceed. Court orders proceeding to be reinstated. As to whether Defendant is competent to self represent, Court orders matter set for hearing. State's motion to increase bail heard. Court orders previous bail reinstated ($1000 CBL, $1000 posted) with turnover to Justice Point. All other terms and conditions remain in effect. Defendant advises the Court he wishes to proceed with attorney Stuller as counsel. Court indicates there is no reason for hearing. Matter is placed on trial calendar.  Jury trial scheduled for September 18, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Reports, filed.
Dated 3/22/2017 from Caroline Carr, Psy.D. Filed.
Justice Point Pretrial status update, filed.
AMENDED, signed and filed.

Defendant Antwan D Bogan in court.  Attorney Virginia m Stuller appears as standby counsel.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for return on doctor's report.  Doctor's report requests that defendant be assessed for competency on an inpatient basis.  Court hears argument from defendant, standby counsel and the state.  Defendant becomes highly emotional and is visibly upset during hearing.  Defendant states he will not cooperate with Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Attorney Stuller makes motion to dismiss.  For reasons as set forth on the record, Court orders inpatient competency evaluation be conducted forthwith.  Court orders defendant taken into custody for purposes of conducting inpatient evaluation.  Defendant is not cooperative while being handcuffed in Court.  Defendant refuses to stand and is escorted out of the courtroom.  Court makes record.  Hearing continues with standby counsel present.   Court orders REMAND pending the outcome of the competency evaluation.  Matter adjourned for return on doctor's report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Order for Competency Evaulation by Department of Health Services, signed and filed with attachments.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.
- dated 2/16/17 from Dr. Pankiewicz, filed.

Same appearances.  Stand by counsel requests matter be re-called.  Stand by counsel advises the Court of mental health history of defendant and medication regimen.  Counsel just received this information after Court ordered the case to be adjourned to tomorrow.  Counsel renews request for competency evaluation.  For reasons as set forth, Court orders competency evaluation be conducted by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  **Defendant abruptly requests to exit the courtroom.  Defendant is visibly upset, Court authorizes defendant to leave the courtroom to collect himself.  Defendant does not return to the courtroom but leaves contact information with the deputy.  Defendant to report on 2/10/17 at 9:00am in Room 504 of the Safety Building for evaluation to be conducted.  Counsel to notify defendant of evaluation date and next court date.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  Court to rule on Miranda motion on next date.  Court orders exhibit 1 withdrawn.  

Filed, signed Order for Competency Evaluation by Department of Health Services

Defendant Antwan D Bogan in court pro se.  Attorney Virginia Stuller appears as stand by counsel.  Defendant Antwan D Bogan in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in Court for continuation of motion hearing and jury trial.  Defendant advises that he is ill today.  Court hears argument re: defendant's motion to adjourn trial.  For reason as set forth,  Court to complete motion hearing today.  Court will recess the trial until tomorrow.  Jury selection to proceed tomorrow at 8:30am.  Defendant abruptly leaves courtroom to use restroom.  Court conducts conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Case continues on the record.  Court hears additional argument from defendant.  Court holds colloquy with defendant.  Miranda motion hearing continues.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Daniel Sebald.  Court holds colloquy with defendant re: his decision to represent himself and competence to proceed.  Stand by counsel formally requests competency evaluation be conducted.  Court hears argument.  Court to place rulings on the record when jury trial resumes on 2/8/17.  Court stand in recess.

Same appearances.  Miranda hearing held.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Joseph Spingola, MPD Detective Brad Mellenthien, MPD Detective Tiffany Skonieczny.  Court hears argument.  Exhibit 1 received over objection of defendant.  State has scheduling conflict with additional witness for this motion.  Miranda motion to continue on 2/6/17 at 8:30am followed by jury selection.

Defendant Antwan D Bogan in court pro se. Attorney Virginia Stuller appear as stand by counsel.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for jury trial today.  State is ready to proceed.  Stand by counsel informs the court that she believes that the defendant may not be competent to proceed.  Court hears argument and makes record.  Trial to proceed.  Court places trial rules on the record.  Defendant requests victim be subpoenaed.  Stand by counsel to assist.  Defendant is challenging statements made to law enforcement.  Court to proceed with Miranda hearing.  Court makes witness exclusion order.  Court orders matter passed until 1:30.  Miranda hearing to proceed at that time.

Defendant Antwan D Bogan in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant in custody. Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for jury trial and motion hearing re: defendant's request to proceed pro se. Court hears argument. Defendant sworn and testified. Court finds defendant waives his right to counsel. Court orders Attorney Wasielewski removed as counsel of record forthwith. Defendant requests to be heard on bail, Court hears argument. Court reduces bail to $2500 with turn over to Justice Point. Motion hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Hearing proceeded.  Defendant file several motions pro se.   Defendant withdraws motion to dismiss counsel and motion to suppress.
